title: Landlord refusing to return deposit
example_text: My landlord is refusing to return my security deposit after I vacated the flat
advice_text: Immediately send a written demand for return of the deposit to your landlord using email or registered post, and keep copies of all communications. Collect your rent agreement, payment receipts, and handover photos as evidence. If the landlord fails to respond within a reasonable time, file a detailed complaint with the Rent Authority in your district. You may also issue a formal legal notice specifying a fixed deadline for repayment. Escalate further by approaching the consumer forum if the deposit is not returned after these steps.

title: Unregistered rent agreement and eviction
example_text: My rent agreement was not registered and now the landlord is asking me to leave
advice_text: Prepare copies of all payment records and communications regarding your tenancy. If your agreement is unregistered and you are being evicted, document the eviction attempt and immediately approach the Rent Authority to file a complaint about both the unregistered agreement and illegal eviction. Request the authority to record your tenancy and intervene. If the landlord continues to pressure you, consider sending a formal notice demanding due process and a proper notice period. Keep all evidence safe for future proceedings.

title: Rent increased without notice
example_text: The landlord has increased the rent without any prior notice
advice_text: Request your landlord in writing to provide a clear explanation and supporting documents for the rent increase. State that you will pay only the agreed rent until proper advance notice is served, as per your agreement. If the landlord insists or threatens eviction, submit a complaint to the Rent Authority with all supporting evidence. Keep all receipts and communication records. If necessary, escalate by seeking intervention from local tenant associations.

title: No water supply in rented flat
example_text: There is no water supply in my rented apartment for the past two days
advice_text: Document the lack of water supply with dated photos, videos, and written complaints to your landlord. Demand urgent restoration of water service and keep all communication as evidence. If the landlord does not act within a reasonable time, file a complaint with the local municipality and notify the Rent Authority in writing. If the issue causes health or hygiene risks, you may also approach the local health authority. Maintain a record of all actions taken.

title: Landlord harassing to evict before lease end
example_text: The landlord is harassing me to evict the house before the lease term ends
advice_text: Keep all messages, call records, and evidence of harassment or threats from your landlord. Do not vacate without written notice or before your lease ends. File a complaint with the Rent Authority detailing the harassment and request intervention to protect your tenancy rights. If you feel unsafe, approach the local police with your evidence. Escalate to higher authorities if the situation does not improve.

title: Landlord charging for electricity without bills
example_text: I am not getting electricity bills separately, but the landlord is charging
advice_text: Ask your landlord for official electricity bills and receipts for any charges. Refuse to pay unless you receive proper documentation matching your usage. If bills are not provided or inflated, file a complaint with the consumer forum and notify the Rent Authority. Retain all payment records and communication for your case. If the landlord disconnects your electricity, contact the local electricity board immediately.

title: Landlord locked my room and won’t let me get belongings
example_text: My landlord has locked my room and is not allowing me to take my belongings
advice_text: Gather proof of your tenancy and payment records. If your landlord has locked your room and is withholding belongings, immediately file a written complaint with the local police citing illegal lockout and withholding of property. Simultaneously, notify the Rent Authority about the incident. Request police assistance to regain access to your possessions. Keep copies of all complaints and responses for further proceedings.

title: Poor building maintenance
example_text: The building maintenance is very poor and the landlord is not addressing complaints
advice_text: Take photographs and document all maintenance issues in your building. Send a detailed written request to your landlord for repairs and keep a record of this communication. If repairs are not completed within a reasonable time, escalate the matter to the local municipality and file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Maintain receipts for any repairs you pay for yourself. Organize fellow tenants if common areas are affected.

title: No rent receipt for three months
example_text: I have not received any receipt for the rent paid for three months
advice_text: Formally request your landlord for rent receipts for the last three months and specify the payment dates and methods used. Provide bank statements or witnesses as supporting evidence. If your landlord refuses or delays, file a complaint with the Rent Authority, attaching your payment proofs. Continue to pay rent through verifiable means like bank transfer or cheque. Retain all future receipts and correspondence.

title: Friends or guests not allowed by landlord
example_text: Landlord is not allowing my friends to visit even during daytime
advice_text: Review your rent agreement for guest policies and document any restrictions imposed by your landlord. If no such restriction exists, send a written request for clarification and keep a record. If you are unreasonably prevented from having guests, file a complaint with the Rent Authority detailing the restriction. Maintain records of any denied entry to your visitors. Seek written confirmation from your landlord of any house rules.

title: Landlord entered my room without informing
example_text: The landlord entered my room without informing me
advice_text: Record the date, time, and details of the landlord’s unauthorized entry, and inform them in writing that such actions violate your right to privacy. Request that prior notice be given for any future entry. If the landlord repeats this behavior, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and, if you feel threatened, approach the local police. Keep all evidence and communication for your records.

title: Leaking ceiling not fixed
example_text: My landlord has not fixed the leaking ceiling despite repeated requests
advice_text: Take clear photos of the leaking ceiling and send a written request for urgent repairs to your landlord, including a deadline for response. If repairs are not carried out, escalate by filing a complaint with the local municipality and notify the Rent Authority. If the issue causes health or property damage, keep documentation for compensation claims. Retain all repair-related communication and receipts.

title: Forced to sign blank rent agreement
example_text: I was forced to sign a blank rent agreement by my landlord
advice_text: Firmly refuse to sign any blank rent agreement and request a fully completed and signed copy for your records. If pressured, document the incident and inform the landlord in writing that you will only sign a filled agreement. Report the attempt to the Rent Authority if necessary. Keep all communication as evidence. Never hand over blank signed documents.

title: Landlord demanding extra painting charges
example_text: Landlord is demanding more money for painting charges after I moved out
advice_text: Ask your landlord for a detailed bill and receipts for any painting charges. Refuse to pay unless you receive proof of actual expenses and work completed. If the landlord deducts from your deposit or demands unfair charges, submit a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide all supporting documents. Maintain all communication and transaction records for your case.

title: Neighbours creating noise and landlord ignoring
example_text: The neighbours are creating a lot of noise and the landlord is not taking action
advice_text: Keep an incident log with dates and descriptions of noise problems caused by neighbours. Notify your landlord in writing about the disturbance and request intervention. If ignored, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and, if necessary, report persistent noise to the local police or municipality. Collect audio or video evidence if possible. Cooperate with other affected tenants to strengthen your case.

title: Threatened with eviction for not paying increased rent
example_text: I am being threatened with eviction if I do not pay increased rent
advice_text: Document all communication and payment records related to the rent increase. If you are threatened with eviction for not paying the increased amount, refuse to pay without valid notice and file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Attach all supporting evidence to your complaint. If the landlord attempts illegal eviction, notify the local police with your documentation. Assert your rights firmly at each stage.

title: Rent in cash without acknowledgment
example_text: My landlord is asking for rent in cash and not giving any acknowledgment
advice_text: Switch to paying rent via bank transfer or cheque and request written receipts for every payment. If the landlord refuses, send a formal request for acknowledgment of payments and keep copies of all correspondence. File a complaint with the Rent Authority if receipts are still denied. Maintain detailed records for your protection in case of disputes.

title: Broken water pipeline not repaired
example_text: The landlord refuses to repair the broken water pipeline
advice_text: Take dated photographs of the broken pipeline and send a written repair request to your landlord. If repairs are not completed promptly, contact the local municipality and file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Keep all communication and receipts for any temporary repairs you arrange. Escalate if water supply is severely affected.

title: Pest infestation not addressed
example_text: There is a pest infestation in the house and the landlord is not doing anything
advice_text: Send a written complaint to your landlord about the pest infestation and request immediate pest control. Document the problem with photos and keep all communication. If the landlord does not act, contact the local municipality’s health department and notify the Rent Authority. Organize with other tenants if the issue is widespread. Keep records for possible compensation claims.

title: Asked to vacate immediately for landlord’s personal reasons
example_text: I am being asked to vacate immediately due to landlord's personal reasons
advice_text: Check your lease for notice period requirements and do not vacate immediately unless proper notice is served. Document any verbal or written requests to vacate for the landlord’s personal reasons. If pressured, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and request intervention. Keep all communication and evidence of tenancy. Only hand over possession after official procedures.

title: Original documents not returned
example_text: The landlord is not returning my original documents given at the time of agreement
advice_text: Formally request the return of your original documents from the landlord and keep a copy of your request. If documents are still withheld, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and, if necessary, approach the local police for assistance in recovering your property. Retain proof of all communication and tenancy records.

title: Discrimination due to religion
example_text: I am facing discrimination from the landlord for my religion
advice_text: Document every incident of discrimination due to religion, including dates, statements, and witnesses. Send a formal complaint to your landlord and request written clarification. If discrimination continues, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and approach the local police or human rights commission. Keep all evidence safely for any further proceedings.

title: Extra charge for using kitchen gas
example_text: Landlord is asking for extra money for using kitchen gas connection
advice_text: Request a detailed written explanation for any extra kitchen gas charges and demand proper receipts. Refuse to pay arbitrary charges. If the landlord persists, file a complaint with the consumer forum and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all payment records and communication as evidence.

title: Improper garbage disposal
example_text: There is no proper garbage disposal and the landlord ignores the issue
advice_text: Take photos of improper garbage disposal and send a written complaint to your landlord, requesting regular cleaning. If not resolved, file a complaint with the local municipality and notify the Rent Authority. Organize with other tenants for collective action if needed. Keep all correspondence and records.

title: Threatened to cut electricity for complaining
example_text: The landlord is threatening to cut electricity if I complain
advice_text: Keep a record of all threats and complaints regarding electricity. If your landlord threatens to cut power for raising concerns, immediately file a complaint with the local electricity board and notify the Rent Authority. If electricity is actually disconnected, approach the local police for prompt restoration. Preserve all evidence for escalation.

title: Not allowed to keep pets
example_text: I am not allowed to keep pets as per landlord's rules
advice_text: Check your rent agreement for pet policy and request written clarification from your landlord. If pets are not explicitly prohibited, assert your right to keep them. If you face unreasonable restrictions, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and attach all supporting documents. Keep all correspondence and evidence.

title: Landlord refusing to renew agreement
example_text: Landlord is refusing to renew my rental agreement
advice_text: Request a written explanation from your landlord for refusal to renew the agreement. Attempt to negotiate renewal and document all discussions. If renewal is denied without valid reason, file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Retain all communication and payment records for reference.

title: Lease copy not provided
example_text: The landlord is not giving me a copy of the lease agreement
advice_text: Send a written request to your landlord for a copy of the lease agreement and keep proof of your request. If the landlord refuses or delays, file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Maintain all payment and communication records as evidence of your tenancy.

title: Deposit deducted for old damages
example_text: My deposit was deducted for damages that were already present
advice_text: Ask your landlord for a detailed list and proof of any damages deducted from your deposit. Refuse to pay for pre-existing or normal wear and tear. If unfair deductions are made, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide supporting evidence. Keep all inspection and communication records.

title: Parking space not provided
example_text: Landlord is not providing parking space as promised
advice_text: Remind your landlord in writing about the agreed parking space and request immediate access. If denied, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and attach your agreement and communication records. Organize with other tenants if multiple people are affected. Retain all evidence for further proceedings.

title: Extra maintenance charge over rent
example_text: The landlord is charging maintenance charges over and above rent
advice_text: Request a detailed breakdown of any extra maintenance charges over rent and demand receipts. Refuse to pay for unagreed charges. If disputes arise, file a complaint with the consumer forum and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all payment and communication records for your case.

title: No advance notice for rent increase
example_text: I was not informed about the rent increase in advance
advice_text: Ask your landlord for advance written notice of any rent increase and keep a copy of your request. Refuse to pay the increased rent until proper notice is given. If the landlord insists or threatens action, file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Retain all communication and payment records.

title: Repairs in kitchen not allowed
example_text: My landlord is not allowing repairs needed in the kitchen
advice_text: Send a written request to your landlord for permission to carry out necessary kitchen repairs, explaining the urgency. If refused, escalate by filing a complaint with the Rent Authority and keeping all communication as evidence. Arrange for repairs only after exhausting these options.

title: Damp issues not fixed
example_text: The flat has serious damp issues but landlord is not fixing them
advice_text: Document all damp issues with photos and dates, and send a written repair request to your landlord. If problems persist, file complaints with the local municipality and the Rent Authority. Keep records of all communication and any health impacts caused by the dampness.

title: Charged for water despite irregular supply
example_text: I am being charged for water even when the supply is irregular
advice_text: Request a detailed water bill and refuse to pay for periods of irregular supply. Document all instances of water shortage and communicate with your landlord in writing. If charges are still demanded, file a complaint with the consumer forum and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all records and payment proofs.

title: Terrace access denied
example_text: Landlord is not allowing me to use the terrace
advice_text: Check your agreement for terrace access rights and request written clarification from your landlord. If access is unfairly denied, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide supporting documents. Organize with other tenants if the terrace is a common area. Retain all correspondence.

title: Forced to vacate for landlord’s family
example_text: I am being forced to vacate due to owner's family moving in
advice_text: Review your lease for notice period requirements and do not vacate for the landlord’s family without official notice. Document all requests to vacate and communicate your position in writing. If pressured, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and keep all evidence.

title: Advance rent not returned
example_text: Landlord is not returning advance rent paid
advice_text: Send a written demand for return of advance rent to your landlord, attaching payment proof. If not refunded within a reasonable time, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide all supporting documents. Escalate to the consumer forum if the amount remains unpaid.

title: No separate electricity meter
example_text: The landlord is not providing separate electricity meter
advice_text: Request your landlord in writing to install a separate electricity meter and keep proof of your request. If refused, approach the local electricity board for guidance and file a complaint with the Rent Authority. Retain all communication and payment records.

title: Threatened to pay extra for AC
example_text: I am being threatened to pay extra for using AC
advice_text: Demand a written explanation and receipts for any extra charges for AC usage. Refuse to pay unless agreed in your contract. If the landlord insists, file a complaint with the consumer forum and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all records and correspondence.

title: Harassed to pay for repairs
example_text: Landlord is harassing me to pay for repairs
advice_text: Request a detailed breakdown of repair costs from your landlord and refuse to pay for repairs that are not your responsibility. Keep all communication and payment proofs. If demands continue, file a complaint with the Rent Authority for resolution.

title: Not allowed to extend stay
example_text: The landlord is not allowing me to extend my stay
advice_text: Send a written request to your landlord for an extension of your stay and document all negotiations. If extension is refused without valid reason, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide your tenancy records. Retain all communication.

title: No rent receipt for online payment
example_text: I am not being given a rent receipt for online payments
advice_text: Request a written rent receipt for your online payment and keep digital payment proofs. If the landlord refuses, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and attach all relevant records. Continue paying rent through verifiable means.

title: Forced to sign new agreement with higher rent
example_text: The landlord is forcing me to sign a new agreement with higher rent
advice_text: Refuse to sign a new agreement with higher rent unless mutually agreed. Document all discussions and reasons for refusal. If pressured, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and retain all communication and previous agreements.

title: Deposit not returned after leaving
example_text: My landlord is not giving me back the deposit after leaving the house
advice_text: Send a written demand for return of your deposit after leaving, attaching proof of payment and handover. If not refunded within a reasonable period, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and escalate to the consumer forum if needed. Retain all communication.

title: Landlord not resolving neighbour disputes
example_text: The landlord is not resolving neighbour disputes affecting my stay
advice_text: Document all neighbour disputes and your communication with the landlord regarding resolution. If the landlord fails to act, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and, if necessary, approach the local police for intervention. Keep all records and evidence.

title: Not allowed to shift before notice period
example_text: Landlord is not allowing me to shift before the notice period ends
advice_text: Request written permission from your landlord if you need to shift before the notice period ends, explaining your situation. If refused, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide supporting documents. Retain all communication for your records.

title: Money deducted for painting not done
example_text: The landlord is deducting money for painting which was not done
advice_text: Request a detailed bill and proof of painting from your landlord. Refuse to pay or accept deductions for work not done. If the landlord insists, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and keep all evidence.

title: Basic amenities not provided
example_text: My landlord is not providing basic amenities as promised
advice_text: List all missing basic amenities and send a formal request to your landlord for immediate provision. If not resolved, file a complaint with the local municipality and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all records and photos for your case.

title: Broken geyser not fixed
example_text: My landlord has refused to fix the broken geyser for weeks
advice_text: Send a written request for urgent geyser repair to your landlord and keep a copy. If repairs are not done, contact the local plumber and inform the Rent Authority. Keep all receipts and communication.

title: Asked to pay for landlord’s repairs
example_text: I am being asked to pay for repairs that are landlord's responsibility
advice_text: Ask your landlord for a breakdown of any repair costs you are asked to pay and refuse to cover repairs that are not your responsibility. Maintain all payment records and communication. File a complaint with the Rent Authority if necessary.

title: Common areas not maintained
example_text: My landlord is not maintaining the common areas
advice_text: Document all maintenance issues in common areas with photos and dates. Send a written request to your landlord for repairs or cleaning. If not resolved, file a complaint with the local municipality and notify the Rent Authority. Keep all evidence.

title: Not allowed to host guests overnight
example_text: The landlord is not allowing me to host guests overnight
advice_text: Check your agreement for guest policy and request written clarification from your landlord. If you are unreasonably prevented from hosting guests overnight, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and provide supporting documents. Retain all records.

title: Deposit not refunded after inspection
example_text: My landlord is not refunding the deposit even after the inspection
advice_text: After inspection, ask your landlord in writing for a clear explanation if your deposit is not refunded. If you do not receive a satisfactory response, file a complaint with the Rent Authority and attach all inspection and payment records. Escalate to the consumer forum if needed.

title: Salary not paid on time
example_text: My employer is not paying my salary on time
advice_text: Immediately request a written explanation for your termination and keep all employment records. If no notice or valid reason is provided, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and include your appointment letter and salary slips. You may also send a formal demand for reinstatement or compensation. Retain all correspondence for further action. Escalate to the labour court if the employer does not respond.

title: Terminated without notice or reason
example_text: I was terminated without any prior notice or reason
advice_text: Track your work hours and request overtime pay in writing from your employer. If extra hours are unpaid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner, attaching your work records and salary slips. Refuse to work overtime unless proper compensation is promised. Keep all communications as evidence. Join with co-workers to strengthen your case if needed.

title: Forced overtime without extra pay
example_text: I am being forced to work overtime without extra pay
advice_text: Collect all salary slips, appointment letter, and PF account details. Send a written demand to your employer for release of your provident fund after leaving the job. If you do not receive payment, file a complaint with the PF office and Labour Commissioner, attaching all supporting documents. Follow up regularly until your dues are cleared.

title: Provident fund not received after leaving job
example_text: I have not received my provident fund after leaving the job
advice_text: Document all incidents of harassment by your boss, noting dates, witnesses, and messages. File a written complaint with your company’s internal committee or HR department. If no action is taken, escalate to the Labour Commissioner or local police with your evidence. Maintain a record of all complaints and responses.

title: Boss harassing at workplace
example_text: My boss is harassing me at the workplace
advice_text: Keep a record of all communication regarding your resignation and pregnancy. If you are asked to resign due to pregnancy, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and Women’s Commission. Demand written reasons for resignation and request maternity benefits. Retain all employment records and correspondence.

title: Asked to resign due to pregnancy
example_text: I was asked to resign due to my pregnancy
advice_text: Send a written request to your employer for your appointment letter and keep proof of communication. If not provided, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your employment records. You may also approach your company’s HR department for resolution. Retain all future employment documents safely.

title: Appointment letter not given

advice_text: Document every incident of caste discrimination at work, including statements, emails, and witnesses. File a formal complaint with HR and escalate to the Labour Commissioner or local anti-discrimination authority. Keep all evidence for further proceedings. Request a written response from your employer.

title: Discriminated at work due to caste
example_text: I am being discriminated against for my caste at work
advice_text: Review your company policy on paid leaves and request your entitled leave in writing. If leaves are denied, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner, attaching your salary slips and appointment letter. Keep records of all leave requests and employer responses for your case.

title: Paid leaves not allowed as per policy
example_text: My company is not allowing paid leaves as per policy
advice_text: Request your gratuity payment in writing from your employer after retirement and keep proof of employment and service period. If payment is delayed or denied, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and gratuity office. Attach all supporting documents and follow up regularly.

title: Gratuity not received after retirement
example_text: I am not getting my gratuity after retirement
advice_text: Ask your employer for a written explanation of any salary deductions and keep your salary slips. If deductions are not valid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach all payment records. Request a refund and keep a record of all correspondence.

example_text: My employer is deducting salary for no valid reason
advice_text: Refuse to sign any blank resignation letter and document the incident. Inform your employer in writing that you will only sign a filled and dated letter. If pressured, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and keep all communication as evidence.

advice_text: Send a written request for safety measures at your workplace to your employer and keep proof of all complaints. If safety is not provided, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and local health authority. Document unsafe conditions with photos and witness statements.

advice_text: Document all communication and evidence of promotion denial due to gender. File a formal complaint with your company’s HR department and escalate to the Labour Commissioner or Women’s Commission if needed. Request a written explanation from your employer.

advice_text: Track your wages and work hours to ensure compliance with minimum wage laws. If underpaid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner, attaching your salary slips and work records. Demand immediate correction and keep all correspondence.

advice_text: Request a written explanation for your transfer and keep all employment records. If transferred without consent, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach all supporting documents. Seek negotiation with your employer for reconsideration.

advice_text: Track your overtime hours and request payment in writing from your employer. If not paid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your work records and salary slips.

advice_text: Track your work hours and pay to ensure equal pay for equal work. If underpaid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner, attaching your salary slips and work records.

title: No breaks allowed during work hours
example_text: My company is not allowing breaks during work hours
advice_text: Request leave for family events in writing from your employer and keep proof of all communication. If denied, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your employment records.

title: Denied leave for family events
example_text: I am being denied leave for important family events
advice_text: Collect all salary slips and PF account details. Send a written request to your employer for PF deposit and keep proof of communication. If PF is deducted but not deposited, file a complaint with the PF office and Labour Commissioner.

title: PF deducted but not deposited
example_text: My employer is deducting PF without depositing it
advice_text: Request payment for your notice period in writing and keep proof of your employment records. If not paid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach all supporting documents.

title: Salary not paid for notice period
example_text: I am not getting salary for notice period
advice_text: Document all incidents of discrimination at your workplace and file a formal complaint with HR. If the company does not act, escalate to the Labour Commissioner or local anti-discrimination authority with your evidence.

title: Company not following anti-discrimination policies
example_text: My company is not following anti-discrimination policies
advice_text: Document all unsafe working conditions and send a written complaint to your employer. If forced to work in unsafe conditions, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and local health authority, attaching photos and witness statements.

title: Forced to work in unsafe conditions
example_text: I am being forced to work in unsafe conditions
advice_text: Document lack of proper toilet facilities at your workplace and send a written complaint to your employer. If not resolved, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and local health authority.

title: Proper toilet facilities not provided
example_text: My employer is not providing proper toilet facilities
advice_text: Track all instances where labour laws are not followed and send a written complaint to your employer. If ignored, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner, attaching all supporting records.

title: Labour laws not followed
example_text: My company is not following labour laws
advice_text: Request your bonus payment in writing from your employer and keep proof of your employment and salary records. If denied, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach all supporting documents.

title: Bonus denied as per law
example_text: I am being denied bonus as per law
advice_text: Document all work on weekends and request extra pay or compensatory leave in writing. If not paid, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your work records and salary slips.

title: Not paid for weekend work
example_text: My employer is not paying me for work done during weekends
advice_text: Request permission to resign in writing from your employer and keep proof of all communication. If not allowed to resign freely, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your employment records.

title: Not allowed to resign freely
example_text: My company is not allowing me to resign freely
advice_text: Request a written termination letter from your employer and keep proof of all communication. If not provided, file a complaint with the Labour Commissioner and attach your employment records.

title: Termination letter not given
example_text: My employer is not giving me termination letter
advice_text: Formally request your termination letter in writing from your employer and keep a copy of your request. If your employer does not provide the letter, collect all employment records, salary slips, and any communication about your termination. File a complaint with the Labour Commissioner stating that you have been terminated without official documentation, and attach all supporting evidence. The termination letter is crucial for future job applications, legal claims, and access to benefits, so insist on receiving it through proper channels.
